glsa.title: Subversion: Denial of service
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in Subversion could lead to a Denial of Service condition.

background.p: Subversion is a version control system intended to eventually replace CVS. Like CVS, it has an optional client-server architecture (where the server can be an Apache server running mod_svn, or an ssh program as in CVS’s :ext: method). In addition to supporting the features found in CVS, Subversion also provides support for moving and copying files and directories.

description.p: A vulnerability was discovered in Subversion’s mod_dav_svn, that could lead to a Denial of Service Condition.

impact.p: An attacker could cause a possible enial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Subversion users should upgrade to the latest version:
